abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Health Services
            Development Project for Benin were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, project sustainability was likely, Bank
            performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also highly satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: this report on the assessment of the
            borrower's performance underlines the importance of
            strong leadership, ownership, vision and risk taking of
            policymakers and managers, both within and outside of
            Ministry of Health (MOH), in conceiving and implementing
            sector reform. This section also points to the cruciality of
            assigning a top-notch team, with the skills and experience
            necessary, to undertake quality work in needs assessment,
            problem analysis and project design and development. The
            Bank's and the Borrower's performance also
            illustrate the value of consulting and involving the
            managers and service providers in the periphery, as well as
            the population, the ultimate beneficiaries, in needs
            assessment and project design. Such a process builds
            ownership and capacity at the local level, both of which are
            essential to successful reform implementation. This report
            provides detail and insight on the positive lessons learned
            with regard to project content, summarized here. In essence,
            the project defined in a holistic fashion all systemic
            constraints to sector performance and addressed them through
            dialogue and interventions both at the macroeconomic,
            cross-sectoral level, as well as within the sector. The
            links and complementarities of the various components and
            actors were well exploited and interwoven to the extent that
            the whole project equaled more than the sum of its
            individual components. Such a project design should be a
            guide for future operations in the sector in this and other regions.

docna.cdata!:
Benin - Health Services Development Project
            : Credit 2031 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Benin - Health Services
            Development Project : Credit 2031 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The key objective of the Health Services
            Development Project is to support a comprehensive package of
            national health policy reforms to strengthen the
            Government's capacity to respond to basic needs of the
            population. Specifically, the project will support the
            Government in: (i) strengthening the institutional
            capabilities of the Ministry of Public Health (MSP) for the
            planning and managing of human and financial resources; (ii)
            improving sector financial resource mobilization; (iii)
            improving the quality of primary health care delivery
            through rehabilitation of vital infrastructure, the
            institutionalization of family health care, and AIDS
            prevention; (iv) developing small pilot programs of hygiene
            and sanitation in urban and peri-urban areas, with emphasis
            on community based initiated; and (v) improving manpower and
            human resources development. The project will also provide
            financing for office furniture, vehicles, and consultant services.
